page.title: 12WISBOROUGH GREEN TAPESTRY
page.content: In 1977, some people decided to commemorate the Silver Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth by embroidering a tapestry depicting the history and life of the village. Pat Gierth, a local artist, made the design. It took eight years to complete and was displayed in the church for the first time in 1985. The border ,framing three panels, shows the wildlife of the area. On background designs of honeysuckle, bindweed and ivy are cameo pictures of buildings, historical events and activities to be seen in and around the village. The middle panel centres on the Green and the old and new school buildings. The coloured wools used reproduce colours that are to be found in the stained glass windows of the church.
